moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 c5 3. d5 g6 4. Nf3 Bg7 5: His pawns are weak on the a/b file.  I intend to exploit this also while aiming to put a knight on e6.
moves.12... Bxg2 13. Kxg2: I like this pocket for my king.  His knight on h5 is useless.
moves.13... f5 14. exf5 Rxf5 15. Nh4 Rf7 16. N: He doesn't have many good moves and I was thinking he would bring the bishop down to d4.
moves.27... Rf7 28. axb6 a6 29. Ra5 Bxf2: Wow, this surprised me as he loses the bishop.
moves.30. Rf1 Qe5 31. Rxf2 Rxf2+ 32. Kxf2 Rxb6: I've got to be careful as a move to b2 results in a draw.
moves.35... Rb1: Pointless to attack when there is none.
moves.36. Rxa6 h5: Can you spot the mate in 9?
moves.37. Ra8+: Check.   King has one square to go to avoid mate in next move.   However, it's all over.
moves.37... Kh7 38. Ng5+:
In this position I set three conditional moves for mate.   38. ..qxg5, 39. qxe7+, kh6, 40. rh8+, nh7, 41. rxh7#.   Or, 38. ...kh6, 39. nf7+, kg7, 40. ne6+, kxf7, 41. rf8#.   Or, 38...kg7, 39. nce6+, kh6, 40. nf7+, kh7, 41. rh8#.

Sweet.
